enb_long_title: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change: Twenty-Second Session of the Subsidiary Bodies
sentences: Following lengthy informal consultations, contact group Chair John Ashe introduced SBI draft conclusions to the contact group containing draft COP 11 decisions on the UNFCCC and Kyoto Protocol budgets for 2006-2007.
The EU and G-77/CHINA supported the proposed budget.
However, the US suggested reducing the Convention budget by US$2 million, while Japan proposed reducing the overall budget by US$3 million.
UNFCCC Executive Secretary Joke Waller-Hunter said a $2 million reduction would 'seriously affect the operations of the Secretariat.
' Noting the lack of consensus, Chair Ashe suggested forwarding the text to SB 23, and closed the meeting. Informal multilateral and bilateral consultations soon resumed.
However, as of 12:30 am Friday morning, delegates had been unable to reach a final agreement.
